Function.Description: The year function returns the second portion of a Date argument.

Brief.Overview: The year function returns the second portion of a Date argument.
Brief.Usage: The year function is used to extract the second component from a Date object.

Argument.Name: dateStr
Argument.Note: A Date in the form mm/dd/yyyy where mm is the month number, dd is the day of the month and yyyy is the year.

Argument.Name: Julian-date
Argument.Note: A Julian date with a fraction extension representing the time for that date. The first two digits after the decimal point in the serial number correspond to a fraction of a 24 hour day. For example 0.00 corresponds to 12:00 AM; 0.25 corresponds to 6:00 AM; 0.50 corresponds to 12:00 Noon and so on.

Syntax.Return: An Integer that represents the year component of the argument
